description: Byzantines are a defensive civilization with strong counter-units and cheap technology costs.
dark_age: Start with 4 villagers and a scout.
Build 2 houses, a mill near berries, and a lumber camp near forests.
Train additional villagers from the town center.
Train 3-4 militia from the barracks and use them to defend your base.
Use the scout to explore the map and find resources.
Advance to Feudal Age at around 22-23 minutes with 500 food and 200 gold.
Have around 1000-1200 food, 200-250 wood, and 100-150 gold at the end of the Dark Age.
Assign 6-7 villagers to food, 4-5 to wood, 1-2 to gold, and 2-3 to stone.
feudal_age: Build archery ranges and stables to produce skirmishers and scouts.
Research feudal age upgrades for infantry and archers.
Build a blacksmith and market to upgrade units and sell excess resources for gold.
Advance to Castle Age at around 29-30 minutes with 800 food and 400 gold.
Have around 2000-2500 food, 800-1000 wood, 400-500 gold, and 200-250 stone at the end of the Feudal Age.
Assign 10-12 villagers to food, 8-9 to wood, 2-3 to gold, and 3-4 to stone.
castle_age: Build additional barracks and continue producing spearmen and pikemen to counter cavalry units.
Research castle age upgrades for infantry and archers.
Build a monastery and start producing monks to convert enemy units.
Advance to Imperial Age at around 38-39 minutes with 1000 food, 1000 gold, and 800 stone.
Have around 4000-4500 food, 2500-3000 wood, 1500-2000 gold, and 1000-1200 stone at the end of the Castle Age.
Assign 25-30 villagers to food, 20-22 to wood, 4-5 to gold, and 8-10 to stone.
imperial_age: Train cataphracts and upgrade them with the unique technology, Logistica, for improved damage.
Use counter-units and monks to defend against enemy attacks.
Assign 50-60 villagers to food, 40-45 to wood, 8-10 to gold, and 16-20 to stone.
